companyDescription.text:
Definity Financial Corporation is the parent company to some of Canada’s most long-standing and innovative property and casualty insurance brands and companies, including Economical Insurance, Sonnet Insurance, Family Insurance Solutions, and Petline Insurance. We focus on making insurance better for our customers, our employees, our broker partners, and our communities.

Our promise to employees is to provide a workplace that’s collaborative, ambitious, rewarding, and empowering. Our inclusive environment provides the space to innovate with colleagues and implement even better ways of doing things. We invest in our employees’ growth and development and help them thrive. With our flexible, hybrid work arrangements, total rewards packages, company share ownership program, and emphasis on work-life balance, it’s better here.

If you’re looking for a career where your perspective and expertise are valued, you’ll find it here at Definity.

* * *

La Société financière Definity est la société mère de compagnies d’assurance de dommages parmi les plus établies et innovatrices au Canada, soit Assurance Economical, Sonnet Assurance, Family Insurance Solutions et la Compagnie d’assurance Petline. Definity est dévouée à faire évoluer l’assurance pour sa clientèle, ses équipes, son réseau de courtage et ses communautés.

Nous promettons de fournir un environnement de travail collaboratif, ambitieux, valorisant et stimulant. Notre environnement inclusif vous permet d’innover avec vos collègues et de mettre en œuvre de meilleures façons de travailler. Nous investissons dans la croissance et le perfectionnement de nos gens et les aidons à s’épanouir. Grâce à nos options flexibles de travail hybride, notre programme de rémunération globale, notre régime d’actionnariat et l’accent sur l’équilibre travail-famille, vous évoluerez avec nous. 

Si vous souhaitez une carrière où votre point de vue sera reconnu, ne cherchez pas plus loin que Definity.

description.text:
Definity includes some of Canada’s most long-standing and innovative insurance brands, including Economical Insurance, Sonnet Insurance, Family Insurance Solutions, and Petline Insurance. With strong roots that date back to 1871, we’ve grown to become a digital leader in the insurance industry. We’re proud to help our clients and communities adapt and thrive in a world of constant change.
Our promise to you: It’s better here. Why? Because we CARE, and we provide an employee experience that’s collaborative, ambitious, rewarding, and empowering.
Our ambition is to be one of Canada’s leading and most innovative P&C insurers. Come be a part of our journey, and love what you do.
Definity offers a flexible, hybrid work experience where employees work from the office and virtually depending on the type of work they are doing and who they are working with. Leaders partner with their teams to find the right balance of on-site and remote work that best meets the needs of their teams, colleagues, brokers and customers, while ensuring collaboration, teamwork and accountability for goals.
What can you expect in this role?
Utilize advanced coding skills to develop and optimize fraud detection algorithms tailored to the insurance industry, leveraging artificial intelligence and machine learning techniques.Analyze vast and intricate insurance data sets, including claims, policy information, and historical patterns, to build networks/graphs and identify emerging fraud trends and anomalies.Develop and implement sophisticated fraud detection models and rules that enable monitoring and analysis of suspicious activities across insurance products and services.Collaborate with data scientists, software developers, and other stakeholders to enhance existing insurance fraud prevention software and develop new AI-driven solutions.Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in fraud detection technologies, coding languages, and AI algorithms specific to the insurance industry, and proactively recommend innovative approaches to mitigate emerging fraud risks.Conduct comprehensive investigations into complex insurance fraud cases, utilizing advanced analytical techniques to identify root causes, patterns, and recommend appropriate mitigation strategies.Present findings, insights, and recommendations to senior management and executive teams in a clear and concise manner, providing actionable intelligence for decision-making and fraud prevention initiatives.Provide mentoring and guidance to junior analysts, sharing expertise in coding, AI applications, and insurance fraud detection methodologies.Ensure compliance with industry regulations, company policies, and data protection standards in all insurance fraud detection and prevention activities.
What do you bring to the role?
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field. Advanced degree preferred.Minimum of 3 years or more experience in the financial Services se with the understanding of how fraud can be perpetuated and detected using data and analytics Proficiency in coding languages such as Python, R, or Java, with a deep understanding of data structures, algorithms, and statistical modeling.Experience in utilizing analytics and machine learning techniques for fraud detection within financial services and prevention.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex insurance data sets and derive actionable insights.Extensive experience using Tableau, Power BI and Excel to gather, connect, analyze and present insights.Exceptional communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively convey technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.Certified Fraud Examiner (CFE) or other relevant certifications are a plus
We also take potential into consideration. If you don’t have this exact experience, but you know you have what it takes, be sure to give us more insight through your application and cover letter.
Go ahead and expect a lot — you deserve it, and we’ve got it: 
Hybrid work schedule for most rolesCompany share ownership programPension and savings programs, with company-matched RRSP contributionsPaid volunteer days and company matching on charitable donationsEducational resources, tuition assistance, and paid time off to study for examsFocus on inclusion with employee groups, support for gender affirmation surgery, access to BIPOC counsellors, access to programs for working parentsWellness and recognition programsDiscounts on products and services
Our inclusive work environment welcomes diversity and supports accessibility. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process, please let us know by contacting: [email protected]
Background checks
This role requires successful clearance of a background check (including criminal checks and leadership references).

companyDescription.text:
Smardt is both the pioneer and world leader in manufacturing high efficiency, oil-free chillers. Smardt has the largest installed base of oil-free chillers in the world, with more than 10000 chillers installed globally. These high-efficiency chillers typically can save building owners 50% of their annual operating costs compared with standard lubricated screw machines through the reduction in power consumption and maintenance.

Smardt manufactures its innovative and highly efficient range of chillers in Montreal Canada, Plattsburgh USA, Melbourne Australia, Stuttgart Germany, and Guangzhou China. Smardt was the first manufacturer to commercially produce high-efficiency oil-free chillers utilising magnetic bearing centrifugal compressors and today has the largest range of such chillers with water-cooled chillers from 60 TR through 3200 TR, air-cooled chillers 60 TR through 450 TR, and evaporatively cooled chillers from 60 TR through 400 TR.

Smardt's goal is to provide energy efficient cooling solutions for the built environment, reducing the energy consumption of HVAC globally and helping to preserve the world for future generations.

description.text:
English version below

La familly Smardt s'aggrandit! Nous cherchons un(e) Ingénieur(e) électrique chevronner pour se joindre à l'équipe d'Ingénierie de production. Se rapportant au Gestionnaire de l'ingénierie, l'Ingénieur(e) électrique sera responsable de la conception de systèmes électriques pour nos refroidisseurs industriels.

Responsabilités

Gérer le flux de travail, attribuer la tâche, soutenir et donner une formation aux membres de l'équipe du service électrique

Examiner et contrôler la qualité des dessins techniques et de la documentation des produits publiés pour assurer la conformité du produit final aux spécifications de performance soumises, à la conception technique

Compléter la tâche d'ingénierie en utilisant différents portails, logiciels et outils de sélection d'ingénierie

Étudier les soumissions de projet, les spécifications techniques et les ordres de travail pour s'assurer que le projet sera réalisé conformément à la conception, aux normes et aux codes soumis Procéder à l'analyse d'amélioration des coûts de la conception de l'unité, des composants, de l'équipement et des méthodes d'assemblage pour trouver et mettre en œuvre des solutions plus rentables

Sélectionner de nouveaux composants et équipements et préparer les spécifications d'achat

Préparer les notifications techniques des produits, les ordres de modification technique et les mémos en compilant les données de la nouvelle conception ou des modifications et les calculs techniques et les méthodologies de sélection

Soutenir et donner une formation au département d'ingénierie des ventes lors de la soumission du projet et de la mise en production en répondant aux questions et préoccupations de l'ingénieur de projet et des clients Soutenir et donner une formation au service de support et de maintenance des produits en résolvant rapidement toutes les plaintes et les problèmes de fonctionnalité pendant le démarrage de l'unité, les réclamations de garantie et après la période de garantie Tenir des réunions quotidiennes et hebdomadaires avec les différents départements, clients ou fournisseurs Tenir à jour les dossiers de certification des produits par une inspection trimestrielle avec le représentant de l'agence de l'autorité et des mises à jour annuelles des dossiers en ajoutant les modifications de conception requises Autres tâches selon les besoins.

Qualifications Requises
 Un baccalauréat est requis en génie électrique, membre de l'ordre des ingénieurs  Un minimum de 5 à 10 ans d'expérience connexe  Une expérience en CVC est avantageuse  Expérience avec ACADE hautement préférée et connaissance d'Autodesk Inventor/Vault et Microsoft Dynamics NAV est un atout  Connaissance des normes/codes de sécurité UL et CSA et des exigences de conception  Une connaissance approfondie de Microsoft Office (Word, Excel PowerPoint) est requise.  Excellentes compétences organisationnelles  Bilingue : français et anglais écrit et parlé. 
____________________________________________________________________________________

The Smardt family is growing! We are looking for a seasoned Electrical Engineer to join the Production Engineering team. Reporting to the Engineering Manager, the Electrical Engineer will be responsible for the design of electrical systems for our industrial chillers.

Responsibilities
 Manage the workflow, assign the task, support and give a training to electrical department team members  Review and control the quality of released product technical dwgs and documentation to ensure the conformance of final product to submitted performance specifications, engineering design  Complete the engineering task by using different engineering selection portals, software and tools  Study the project submittals, technical specification and work orders to assure the project will be completed according submitted design, standards and codes  Proceed the cost-improving analysis of unit design, components, equipment and assembly methods to find and implement more cost-effective solutions  Select new components and equipment and prepare the purchase specification  Prepare the product technical notifications, engineering change orders and memos by compiling the data of new design or changes and technical calculations & selection methodologies  Support and give a training to sales engineering department during the project submitting and releasing in production by answering project engineer and customer questions and concerns  Support and give a training to product support and maintenance department by fast re-solving of all complaints and functionality issues during the unit start-up , warranty claims and after warranty period  Hold daily and weekly meetings with the different departments, customers or suppliers  Keep up to date the product certification files by quarterly inspection with the authority agency representative and annual file updates by adding the required design modifications  Other duties as required. 
Qualifications
 A bachelor’s degree is required in Electrical Engineering, Member of the order of engineers  A minimum of 5-10 years’ related experience  Experience in HVAC is advantageous  Experience with ACADE highly preferred and knowledge of Autodesk Inventor/Vault & Microsoft Dynamics NAV is an asset  Knowledge of UL & CSA safety standards/codes and design requirements  Proficient knowledge in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel PowerPoint) is required.  Excellent organizational skills  Bilingual: French and English written and spoken.

description.text:
Company Description
 
At AECOM, we’re delivering a better world.
 
We believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether it’s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive.
 
Our clients trust us to bring together the best people, ideas, technical expertise and digital solutions to our work in transportation, buildings, water, the environment and new energy. We’re one global team – 47,000 strong – driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world.
 
Here, you will have freedom to grow in a world of opportunity.
 
We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.
 
You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.
 
We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business.
 
We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career.
 
When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.
 
Job Description
 
AECOM is seeking a qualified Lead Airside Design Engineer to join our team in Canada.
 
As a member of our team, your responsibilities would be the following:
 Assist or act as the lead pavement engineer and/or project manager for airside pavement engineering and/or pavement management projects. Provide leadership through technical supervision and mentoring of junior team members. Provide relevant feedback and instructions to team members and relevant updates to clients. Adhere to project schedules, budgets, and objectives. Participate in internal and external project meetings. Plan, organize, and carry out pavement evaluations and investigations. Write and review/approve reports and specifications and make presentations. Preparing technical reports, including technical specifications, pavement design reports. Completion of Pavement Condition Index (PCI), assessment of airside pavement types and rehabilitation. Establishes design criteria and performs detailed design for civil works related to runways, taxiways and aprons, holding and deicing bays. Assist other Project Managers in preparing field documentation and organizing field activities. Prepare staging / phasing plans for pavement construction and submits to / coordinates with airport operations team / Transport Canada as applicable. Perform quality control/quality assurance of field work, field data analysis and interpretation, and engineering calculations. Perform review of pavement engineering analysis, designs, performance data, and reports. Assist other team members with the preparation of proposals and expressions of interest considering the methodology for undertaking potential projects. Other office and/or offsite activities, as required. 
Qualifications
 
Minimum Requirements:
 Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering + 8 years experience in airfield engineering design Registered professional engineer or eligible within 18 months Valid full passenger-vehicle driver’s license for applicable province. 
Preferred Qualifications:
 Bachelor degree with emphasis in Pavement Engineering, Geotechnical Engineering, or any related technical field. Ideally 12+ years of experienced in airfield engineering design Knowledge and experience of airfield pavement, drainage, grading design, materials specification and maintenance. 
Additional Information
 
With infrastructure investment accelerating worldwide, our services are in great demand, and there’s never been a better time to be at AECOM! Join us, and you’ll get all the benefits of being a part of a global, publicly traded firm – access to industry-leading technology and thinking and transformational work with big impact and work flexibility.
 
AECOM provides a wide array of compensation and benefits programs to meet the diverse needs of our employees and their families. We also provide a robust global well-being program. We’re the world’s trusted global infrastructure firm, and we’re in this together – your growth and success are ours too.
 
As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.
 
Join us and let’s get started.

companyDescription.text:
Altair (Nasdaq: ALTR) is a global leader in computational science and intelligence, which provides software and cloud solutions in the areas of simulation, high-performance computing (HPC), and artificial intelligence (AI). Altair enables organizations in nearly every industry to compete more effectively in a connected world while creating a more sustainable future. 

Our vision is to leverage computational science to drive innovation and intelligent decisions for a more connected, safe, and sustainable future. 

Wherever you are and whatever you’re doing, Altair’s solutions surround you – keeping you safer, more connected, and more productive. They can be found in big places and small — on highways, hospitals, and hockey rinks, in stadiums, skyscrapers, and subways, and in banks, bikes, and boats.

A critical component of our success has been our company culture, based on our core values of innovation, envisioning the future, communicating honestly and broadly, seeking technology and business firsts, and embracing diversity. We continually recruit for top talent and invest in our global workforce to fuel diversity, professional and personal growth, and innovation. At Altair, diversity and experiences are embraced and essential to our success and long-term growth. We are proud of the recognition our world-class culture, diversity, and sustainability efforts have garnered, including being named to Inc. magazines Best Led Companies List, Newsweek's Most Loved Workplaces, and Investor’s Business Daily’s Best 100 ESG Companies list.

For nearly 40 years, Altair has helped companies in their digital transformation efforts to make smarter decisions, save costs, reduce waste, accelerate time-to-market, improve business performance, and evolve to a data-driven culture.

In solving our customers’ toughest challenges and delivering unparalleled service, we are helping the innovators innovate, drive better decisions, and turn today’s problems into tomorrow’s opportunities.

description.text:
Transforming the Future with Convergence of Simulation and Data 

Project Leader / Specialist / Associate Timing / Scheduling / Specifications

Job Summary

Our client in Kanata, ON is looking for a Project Leader / Specialist / Associate Timing / Scheduling / Specifications. This is a contract position.

What You Will Do

As an Vehicle Software Updates - Systems Engineer, you will work with a team that is determined to deliver a robust and reliable Software Update solution to customers, continually increasing the value and functionality of the vehicles that our customers rely on every day.

What You'll Be Able To Do
 Support ongoing software update release activities for Multi-Module OTA products across a variety of vehicle programs.  Coordinate between multiple teams to triage, diagnose, and coordinate resolution of issues found during software update pre-release testing.  Participate in ongoing test activities for a variety of electronic control modules and coordinate between the program teams and the suppliers to ensure that issues are tracked and resolved in a timely manner.  Coordinate software development and integration activities between our client´s Company and its multiple suppliers to ensure a consistent, reliable, and predictable software update experience for customers.  Author, update, and distribute various requirement and specification documents, and work with a variety of individuals to educate and train them on the software update behaviors specified by those documents.  Candidate will work with a diverse and global cross-functional team that includes electronic control unit (ECU) clients, Global Cloud based IT infrastructure, Enterprise IT systems, and other feature teams that have dependencies on the OTA solution. 

Basics
 Bachelor´s Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or Computer Science (or equivalent).  3 or more years of software or hardware development experience.  A minimum of 1 year of cumulative experience in software development, using at least two different programming languages.  1 year or more working as a Product Owner, or Systems Engineer or Technical Product Manager in the Software Industry.  3+ years of experience required. 

Preferred
 Ability to work well in a collaborative, extreme agile development team with business and development partners.  Ability to translate Business Requirements into system level Technical Requirements for cascade to Software Development Community on the Embedded side as well as Cloud side.  Experience working with end-customer facing systems.  Experience with developing or testing embedded systems (cell phones, automotive, control systems, drones, etc.).  Understanding ownership of product end-to-end (goals, strategy, development, testing, launch, and support).  Ability to work independently, provide thought leadership, and demonstrate vision into product improvements as technologies mature over time.  Ability to be detail oriented.  Extremely strong communication skills, capable of abstracting material to appropriate level of leadership. 

How You Will Be Successful
 Envision the Future  Communicate Honestly and Broadly  Seek Technology and Business “First”  Embrace Diversity and Take Risks 

What We Offer
 Competitive Salary  Comprehensive Benefit Package  401(k) with matching contributions  Paid Time Off  Employee Discounts  Free training on all Altair products 

Why Work With Us

Altair is a global technology company providing software and cloud solutions in the areas of data analytics, product development, and high-performance computing (HPC). Altair enables organizations in nearly every industry to compete more effectively in a connected world, while creating a more sustainable future. With more than 3,000 engineers, scientists, and creative thinkers in 25 countries, we help solve our customer’s toughest challenges and deliver unparalleled service, helping the innovators innovate, drive better decisions, and turn today’s problems into tomorrow’s opportunities.

 Our vision is to transform customer decision making with data analytics, simulation, and high-performance computing. 

For more than 30 years, we have been helping our customers integrate electronics and controls with mechanical design to expand product value, develop AI, simulation and data-driven digital twins to drive better decisions, and deliver advanced HPC and cloud solutions to support unlimited idea exploration. To learn more, please visit altair.com

 Ready to go? #ONLYFORWARD 

At our core we are explorers; adventures; pioneers. We are the brains behind some of the world’s most revolutionary innovations and are not only comfortable in new and unchartered waters, we dive headfirst. We are the original trailblazers that make the impossible possible, discovering new solutions to our customer’s toughest challenges.

Altair is an equal opportunity employer. Our backgrounds are diverse, and every member of our global team is critical to our success. Altair’s history demonstrations a belief that empowering each individual authentic voice reinforces a culture that thrives because of the uniqueness among our team.

companyDescription.text:
Newcrest is the largest gold producer listed on the Australian Securities Exchange and one of the world’s largest gold mining companies.

We are committed to supporting a safe, diverse and inclusive culture where our talents and differences are valued. 

Our activities in Australia and overseas mean our people are increasingly presented with more unique learning and development possibilities and opportunities to travel than ever before. 

With world-class opportunities across many diverse locations, Newcrest gives employees the chance to apply skills and expertise in the global mining community, providing opportunities to gain broad experience on a variety of projects in a range of geographies.

Newcrest’s mission is to deliver superior returns from finding, developing and operating gold/copper mines. Our vision is to be the Miner of Choice™. We will lead the way in safe, responsible, efficient and profitable mining.

We value: 
- Caring about people - Keeping people safe and healthy and respecting our communities and the environment. 
 
- Integrity and honesty - Doing what we say we will do, and doing the right thing. 
 
- Working together - Having shared goals and helping one another to achieve them. 
 
- Innovation and problem solving - Challenging convention and finding a better way. 
 
- High Performance - Seeking high performance in ourselves and others.

description.text:
Explore The Unknown
Newcrest is one of the world's largest gold mining companies. As a global business, we aim to create a diverse and inclusive environment where everyone feels safe, valued, and supported to bring their whole unique self to work.
We recognise that our different backgrounds and perspectives help us find better ways to: solve problems; attract and retain the best people; explore, develop, and produce more gold safely and profitably; and help make Newcrest a better place to work.
Our Red Chris mine is located on the traditional territory of the Tahltan and we encourage qualified applicants from the local communities to apply. We offer several designated marshalling points within BC including Nanaimo, Vancouver, Kelowna, Kamloops, Williams Lake, Prince George, Smithers, and Calgary, AB.
This Senior Engineer- Mine Operations will report to the Superintendent, Open Pit Mining and will ensure the safe delivery of capital and operational projects focused on safe production. The role works closely with the Superintendent and Manager – Open Pit Mining to execute the key projects for operations.
We are seeking an individual for a Fly In, Fly Out opportunity working on a two weeks in, two weeks out rotation.
Accountabilities
Safety: Demonstrate absolute commitment and leadership in providing a safe working environment by:
Promote and maintain a culture of ‘safe production’ by compliance with company safety systems, policies, procedures, accountabilities, standards, and Mine Operations New Safe Behaviours.Lead and participate in incident investigation groups and follow up with investigation outcomes as required.Display visible felt leadership by engaging with operational personnelUtilise risk management tools (JSEA or FRA) and crucial control management tools (FCCC)Uphold open pit standards and procedures. Perform audit and identify/remediate hazards as requiredEnsure all incidents, near miss and hazards are reported and recorded in CHESS; are investigated and closed out in a timely mannerParticipate in NewSafe meetings and aid all aspects of the program for 100% success.
Technical Accountabilities
Balance workload and make decisions in coordination with other stakeholders to achieve safe project outcomes.Actively manage project spend and facilitate procurement and logistics.Analyse fleet management data (CAT MineStar) and provide data visualization to assist with operational decision making.Identify, scope & execute productivity enhancement opportunities to increase Overall Equipment Effectiveness (OEE) using the following levers - Payload, Cycle time, Effective UtilizationExecute D&B optimization opportunities in consultation the D&B Engineer and crew members as required.Comply with Red Chris standards, procedures, policies, and government legislation.Create business cases for improvement projects utilizing a combination of data driven approaches and operational competencies.Produce concise project execution plans that clear define process and desired outcomes for project work.Evaluate and aid in execution of operational uplift opportunities.Accountability for Mine Operations Wave project progression. Creation, valuation, implementation, and weekly tracking. Lead the drive for generating value using the system.
Scheduling And Financial Accountabilities
Collaborate with technical services staff on a day-to-day basis and participate in the weekly mine planning strategy sessions, ensuring all projects are prioritised in the schedule & have resources allocated where required.Working with the Mine Manager and Mine Superintendent, provide information to finance staff during monthly cost report creation and generate quarterly budget forecasts.CAPEX and OPEX project creation, execution, and sustainabilityEngage suppliers and contractors in out to market (OTM) exercises.Ability to make informed decisions based on available information, even when faced with constraints such as lack of time, uncertainty, or ambiguity.Create, implement, and monitor all month end productivity and cost reporting for operations. Highlights issues and generate potential solutions for variance in conjunction with Mine Superintendent and Manager.
People Accountabilities
Manage and supervise contractors for mine projects and ensure tracking and progress payments are maintained.Provide coverage for General Foremen and/or team lead positions (depending on development focus)Display excellent communication practices by actively engaging with key stakeholders & interface departmentsProvide regular feedback on project progression, successes, and headwinds (manage up)Engage the team to actively promote Hazard Awareness and the reporting of Near Misses.Ability to lead an inclusive culture where people can openly and freely share their opinions.Display behaviour consistent with Newcrest’s Code of Conduct and ValuesBe actively involved with the operators by creating and delivering monthly presentations on interesting and uplifting information to the crews. Completed projects, opportunities identified, etc.
Our Commitment To You
At Newcrest, we hold core values that focus on caring about people, working together, and achieving a high-performance culture through innovation and problem solving.
Newcrest’s commitment to diversity and inclusion respects both the rights of every individual to work to their highest potential, free of discrimination, as well as the cultures, religions, and governing codes applicable to each country in which we operate.
If you share our values and feel that you could make a meaningful difference in this role, please apply online before the advertised application closing date.

description.text:
Do you have a minimum of 3 years of Process Engineer experience within the metal or aluminum industry? Adecco is currently hiring a full-time Casting Process Engineer to work a one-year contract for a well-established mining and metals company. Your expertise will shine as you become part of the Processing Technical Team at a modernized aluminum smelter in picturesque Kitimat, BC. If you're a technical wizard with an unwavering passion for metals and materials processing, this extraordinary opportunity is calling your name! Apply now and make this role yours today!
Location: Kitimat, BCShifts: Monday - FridayJob type: Full-time | 1-year contract with possibility of extensionRelocation assistance provided, No Fly-in-fly-out arrangements offered

Here's why you should apply: 
Free access to our Aspire Academy for continuing professional educationHires fast, pays weeklyVacation Pay paid out on each weekly pay chequeMedical and dental benefits once qualifiedFree training programs

Duties and Responsibilities: 
Monitoring and reporting on process performance, identifying, and correcting process deviations and driving process improvementsLeading and/or supporting projects to improve safety, process and cost performance ensuring maximum value delivery to the organizationSupporting operations in day-to-day problem solving and ensuring the impact on process stability is considered in all decision makingSupporting operations personnel in the development and maintenance of their technical expertise, including training, and coaching where requiredInteracting with our global network of technical experts to bring additional expertise to bear when required and to drive plant performanceProviding occasional technical support outside of normal work hoursActing as a credible technical resource to supervisors and technicians in their own sector and influencing peers and leaders by providing solid input in projects and daily activities

Requirements & Qualifications: 
Must be local to Kitimat, BC or willing to relocateBachelor's degree in a related field, such as Process Control, Mineral Processing, Chemical Engineering, Metallurgy, or otherA member of, or eligible to register with APEGBC as an EngineerMinimum 3+ years of Process Engineer experience within the metal or aluminum industry is a mustExperience with Lean Six Sigma methodology is an assetA commitment to the safety of yourself and your teamA proven aptitude for problem-solving and statistical data analysisCollaborative attitude and strong communication skills with the ability to communicate complex technical information simply and succinctlyMust be legally eligible to work, and reside in Canada

Don't miss out on this Casting Process Engineer job opportunity in Kitimat, BC. Apply now and an Adecco recruiter will reach out if you qualify!

description.text:
Arobas Personnel est à la recherche d’un Analyste fonctionnel de données ETL pour un mandat chez un de ses clients situé à Montréal.

*Télétravail : Mode Hybride – 1 jour/semaine au bureau*

Dans le cadre du projet du Système de surveillance des actifs, la ressource prendra en charge les responsabilités d'analyste fonctionnel à majeure applicative, avec de très bonnes connaissances en analyse et conversion des données, pour le domaine électrique.La ressource sera principalement analyste, va travailler en étroitement collaboration avec l’architecte fonctionnel sur le dossier de conversion et aussi le développeur Talend de la cellule conversion, mais aussi travailler avec le Responsable Produit (RP), le scrum master, le DBA, le chargé de projet, et les utilisateurs finaux des solutions à mettre en place.

À quoi ressemblera ton quotidien?
 Croissement des données pour la réalisation de la création des modèles d’actifs  Créer les requêtes qui vont servir à fournir les données pour la création des modèles d’actif  Rédaction des règles de transformation pour les différentes tâches  Croissement des données pour la création des encadrements génériques conversion  Créer les requêtes d’extraction des données qui seront importé pour la création des encadrements  Élaboration gabarit d’importation en collaboration avec l’architecte fonctionnel  Rédaction des intrants au script de conversion  Élaborations des critères d’acceptation  Valider les opérations de chargement et de conversion  Valide en collaboration avec l’architecte fonctionnel les règles de transformation édictée  Valide en collaboration avec l’architecte fonctionnel les données à importer/créer  Faire l’analyse de la logique du système existant et la documentation au besoin, dans le cadre de systèmes complexes.  Rédiger des dossiers fonctionnels de qualité (documents fonctionnels en liens avec la conversion  Participe à des ateliers de conception avec l’architecte fonctionnel de la cellule et les clients  Il supporte en collaboration avec l’architecte fonctionnel l’équipe de développement, au quotidien en mode agile, en définissant et en raffinant les spécifications des fonctionnalités à développer 
Qu’est-ce qu’on recherche?

companyDescription.text:
IQVIA (NYSE:IQV) is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions, and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. IQVIA creates intelligent connections across all aspects of healthcare through its analytics, transformative technology, big data resources and extensive domain expertise. IQVIA Connected Intelligence™ delivers powerful insights with speed and agility — enabling customers to accelerate the clinical development and commercialization of innovative medical treatments that improve healthcare outcomes for patients. With approximately 86,000 employees, IQVIA conducts operations in more than 100 countries.

IQVIA is a global leader in protecting individual patient privacy. The company uses a wide variety of privacy-enhancing technologies and safeguards to protect individual privacy while generating and analyzing information on a scale that helps healthcare stakeholders identify disease patterns and correlate with the precise treatment path and therapy needed for better outcomes. IQVIA’s insights and execution capabilities help biotech, medical device and pharmaceutical companies, medical researchers, government agencies, payers and other healthcare stakeholders tap into a deeper understanding of diseases, human behaviors and scientific advances, in an effort to advance their path toward cures. To learn more, visit www.iqvia.com.

description.text:
Summary: Make a significant impact on study success for a biopharma company. Join our sponsor-dedicated biostatistics team to work fully within the sponsor environment, progressing with internal study initiatives over the years. Therapeutic focus is Oncology and/or Rare Disease, involvement in Phase II and III studies.

Job Level: Principal Biostatistician or Associate Director, Biostatistics

Location: Home-based in United States or Canada

Job Expectations:
Input to statistical strategy, lead components and fully support conduct in study design, protocol development, data collection, data analysis, report and submission preparation.Authors or oversees authorship of Statistical Analysis Plans (SAPs) and Statistical Programming Plans (SPPs). Ensure rigorous approaches are taken to ensure good scientific practices as followed: proper statistical methods utilized in analysis plans, and assay methods are appropriately designed, blinded, and randomized to meet objectives.Provides statistical guidance/oversight to statisticians regarding requirements and GCP standards.Performs exploratory statistical analyses and quantifies the benefits, risks, values and uncertainties of drug research and development to make sound conclusions and propose drug development strategies.Makes statistical contributions to clinical study reports, including authoring of statistical methods, data interpretation Clinical Study Reports (CSRs), and manuscripts for publication / presentation.Support biostatistics interactions with regulatory authorities (FDA, EMA, PMDA).Ensure timeliness and quality of deliverables by external vendors; conduct reviews of deliverables to ensure quality.Act as a Thought Partner for innovative study design and clinical development plans.Support or lead improvement initiatives within the department and organization.
Qualifications:
PhD with 5+ years of industry experience or MS with 8+ years of industry experience as a Biostatistician.Experience providing statistical leadership at a study level.Demonstrated statistical contributions in facilitating and optimizing clinical development.Experience supporting regulatory interactions or submissions is preferred.Expertise in statistical methodologies in the context of clinical development.Good working knowledge in SAS and/or R.
IQVIA is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. We believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com

We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all, including veterans and candidates with disabilities. https://jobs.iqvia.com/eoe

As the COVID-19 virus continues to evolve, IQVIA’s ability to operate and provide certain services to customers and partners necessitates IQVIA and its employees meet specific requirements regarding vaccination status. https://jobs.iqvia.com/covid-19-vaccine-status

companyDescription.text:
World leader in engineering and R&D services, Capgemini Engineering combines its broad industry knowledge and cutting-edge technologies in digital and software to support the convergence of the physical and digital worlds. Coupled with the capabilities of the rest of the Group, it helps clients to accelerate their journey towards Intelligent Industry. Capgemini Engineering has more than 65,000 engineer and scientist team members in over 30 countries across sectors including Aeronautics, Space, Defense, Naval, Automotive, Rail, Infrastructure & Transportation, Energy, Utilities & Chemicals, Life Sciences, Communications, Semiconductor & Electronics, Industrial & Consumer, Software & Internet.

Capgemini Engineering is an integral part of the Capgemini Group, a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. The Group is guided every day by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of 360,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong 55-year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering, and platforms. The Group reported in 2022 global revenues of €22 billion.
Get the Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

Job description:

Fuel & Inerting Systems Integrator is responsible for but not limited to supporting technical fuel system related activities for a commercial aircraft. Tasks include technically leading sustaining and new fuel systems design developments, production support, aircraft modification and service difficulty support.

Key Responsibilities:
Prepare and define Technical Requirement Documents and Engineering Technical AssessmentsEvaluate vendor technical proposals and internal Program Change RequestsReview and approve vendor requirement specifications, design/ substantiation documentation.Support aircraft test programsPrepare technical reports to show compliance to the applicable certification requirements.Support in service aircraft by creating and reviewing engineering modification packages based on customer or regulatory change requests. Support Service Bulletin development. Support in service aircraft fleet investigation by addressing in Service Difficulty Reports.Support aircraft production including problem solving and snag resolution (MRB experience)

Qualification:
You hold a degree in Aerospace or Mechanical engineering.You have 10+ years of experience working to integrate Fuel & FTIS changes at aircraft level.Knowledgeable with civil airworthiness FAR Part 25 regulations relating to the fuel system and have a working understanding of industry advisory material for applicable TCCA, EASA, and FAA certification requirements.Familiar with Problem Reports (to document Root Cause, Immediate Failure Effect, Corrective Actions, Evidence)Familiar with Technical content of Service BulletinsIndependent to manage tasks directly with supplier and client stakeholdersIntermediate to advanced skill set in MS Office Suite (Word, Excel & PowerPoint)You have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.You have the capacity to reliably meet deadlines while paying close attention to details.You have the capacity to express ideas clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing, in English. Ability to communicate in French is an added advantage

Job Location: Mirabel, QC, Canada.

Required Skills:

System Integration, Fuel systems, PCR, MRB

companyDescription.text: International Paper (NYSE: IP) is a global producer of planet-friendly packaging, pulp and other fiber-based products, and one of the world's largest recyclers. Headquartered in Memphis, Tenn., we employ approximately 39,000 colleagues globally who are committed to creating what's next. We serve customers worldwide, with manufacturing operations in North America, Latin America, North Africa and Europe. Net sales for 2022 were $21.2 billion. Additional information can be found by visiting InternationalPaper.com.

description.text:
Description
What if you were given the opportunity and responsibility to make a difference? This is your opportunity to be part of International Paper, a Fortune 500 company and global leader in paper and packaging products. IP is known for our commitment to the environment and to cutting-edge technology. We have spent more than 100 years creating new ideas, and we are looking for people who can collaborate to help us build on our history, while creating future success. We are committed to attracting, preparing, promoting and supporting our teams. At International Paper, you control your destiny. We offer benefits, challenges, global opportunities and total rewards. When we say Infinite Possibilities, we mean it.
Our pulp and paper mills are complex facilities that sustainably convert trees and/or recycled fiber into products, such as boxes, sheets of paper, and fluff pulp for hygiene and other products. Hundreds of interrelated mechanical, electrical, and chemical unit processes provide unlimited opportunities to utilize a combination of technical and people skills.
Senior Process Engineer– Grande Prairie, AB
Position Scope
The Senior Process Engineer is an experienced technical resource within the operations and manufacturing excellence (ME) teams supporting one of the Grande Prairie mill’s operation business units. The operational business units encompass all processes for our Kraft pulp mill located in Grande Prairie, Alberta. The position requires relocation to Grande Prairie. The candidate must have reliable transportation. The mill is located approximately 10 km south of the City Grande Prairie.
The ME processes use Lean and Six Sigma concepts to help the mill identify, prioritize, and implement key process, reliability, and cost improvement projects. This specific position works within a larger ME team, which may lead to cross-functional responsibilities. The position reports to the Manager of Manufacturing Excellence, and also reports to a functional manager dependent on team assignments.
Position Responsibilities
The Senior Process Engineer will work closely with a variety of functional groups throughout the mill including operations, maintenance, reliability, capital engineering, manufacturing excellence and management. Lead problem trouble shooting while utilizing reliability and ME skills set; RCFA, FMEA, 5 Why, Kepner Tregoe, Driver Tree, etc.Support the mill and business unit to advance 5S program by facilitating or coaching 5S improvement teamsProject management and coordinationIdentify, develop, manage and deliver sustainable cost savings projects targeted at achieving year over year cost reduction performance through:Multiple capital projectsMultiple non-capital deliberate and continuous improvement initiativesSupport cost reduction capital project development and implementationAchieve certifications in Lean Six-Sigma Yellow Belt and Green BeltServe as a coach for employees working on their Belt projectsInfluence business unit operations teams to utilize ME tools and processes to support successful project delivery and sustainability of improvementsImplement systems to improve/sustain resultsSupport and lead mill cost-reduction initiativesUtilize data analysis tools to drive decision making; Minitab, Braincube, SimcaSupport mill Production ModelResponsible for tracking implementation progress and results for cost reduction initiatives
When the Senior Process Engineer has a primary assignment within the operations department, the responsibilities include the following focus:
Provide visible and active leadership in delivering excellent safety resultsFulfill weekend duty as scheduled – on-call and week-end update meetingsImplement, support and drive Braincube use in departmentDevelop process equipment expertise in a Kraft mill environmentProvide day-to-day technical support and process troubleshootingMonitor key performance indicators to ensure reliable and low cost performanceOptimize processes and provide input on controls improvementsManage small projects, trial plans and transition plans following capital deploymentSupervise work or projects during outagesParticipate or lead failure analysis of process equipment and proceduresTake-on operations-maintenance position coverage from time to time
Desired Skills
Ability to instill safety as a core value and effectively communicate a shared vision for safetyInterest and ability to be a quick study on mill equipment, systems and processesStrong communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate to groups and individuals at all levelsApproach positional responsibilities in an inclusive manner by engaging team members in the area, department, or millAutoCAD skills are a desirable assetAbility to structure project management to plan, resource and deliver projects and initiativesSelf-starter, team playerLean & Six Sigma certifications are a strong asset.Utilize strong organizational skills to handle multiple tasks effectively
Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in Chemical Engineering is requiredMinimum of 5-10 years’ operations, maintenance, or engineering experiencePreference given to those with a background in a Kraft pulp manufacturing environment
Interview Process
The recruitment team at International Paper - Grande Prairie conducts engineering recruitment interviews which comprise a combination of behavior-based and technical questions. Applicants are encouraged to practice the STAR method to answer behavior based questions.
Desired Competencies
Action Oriented, Timely Decision Making, Decision Quality, Organizing, Planning, Perseverance, Priority Setting, Problem Solving, Drive For Results, Time Management, Managing Through Systems, Written Communication, Customer Focus, Dealing with Ambiguity, Functional/Technical Skills, Learning on the Fly, Self-Development, Technical Learning, Peer Relationships, Coaching and Developing Others, Motivates Team, Informing, Influencing, Integrity & Trust, Interpersonal Savvy, Listening, Business Acumen,
International Paper is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law

companyDescription.text:
Industrial Process Heating Solutions

Through its global network, Thermon provides safe, reliable and innovative mission critical industrial process heating solutions. Thermon serves the global energy, power generation and chemical markets to provide innovative solutions for industrial heating applications by deeply understanding our customers’ needs. We specialize in providing complete flow assurance, process heating, temperature maintenance, freeze protection and environmental monitoring solutions.

Global Capabilities
With global design, manufacturing, and warehouse facilities, Thermon is capable of supplying industrial process heating solutions that meet the needs of customers around the world. These state-of-the-art facilities incorporate patented manufacturing processes utilizing computer-controlled equipment, laser technology and infrared imagery. Each design office is fully staffed to provide complete engineering services.

Complete Process Heating Solutions
As an independent manufacturing, design and support organization, Thermon can supply a complete range of products, design services, project management, site installation, system audits, maintenance and training with performance guaranteed.

description.text:
Who We Are
Thermon Canada Inc. is a World leader in Process heating systems. We are currently experiencing rapid growth due to global expansion.
We design and manufacture heating and filtration systems for the Energy sector primarily Oil, Gas, Nuclear and process heating applications.
Thermon has an established record of innovation and excellence. We recognize this is only possible with the hard work and dedication of our employees. We strive to maintain a dynamic and diverse workforce.
We offer environments where collaboration, mentoring and professional growth are encouraged. Ideal candidates for our team will recognize the value of being a part of an organization that not only provides a competitive wage but that also promises a great career.
Through our values, Care, Commit and Collaborate, Thermon strives to be the world leader in industrial process heating solutions by creating a culture of passionate people that are dedicated to anticipating customer needs.
The Role
The Engineering/Construction Project Manager is responsible for all business activities related to Construction Project Management for the Region and/or location. Defines the management, goal definitions, target setting and leadership of the Project Management team and is responsible for the business objectives under this scope of responsibilities.
What You Will Do
Work closely with Engineering, Project Controls, Project Accounting, Estimating, and Construction Management teams.Ensure engineering/construction quality is managed in accordance with client specifications. Work closely with the Edmonton Engineering team to resolve site engineering and construction related technical issues.Prepare engineering estimates, trends, engineering work packages (EWPs) and construction work packages (CWPs) for various projects.Interpret engineering data and provide analytical solutions. Create and monitor project cost controls and a working budget. Prepare a monthly budget report. Develop a schedule to be utilized in the preparation of progress billings, ensuring accurate invoicing and timely receipt of payments.Supervise the installation of construction contracts. Monitor job progress, maintain communication and report findings with Construction Manager and all appropriate stakeholders.Responsible for manning and designation of construction crew's composition required for installation and construction contracts.Required to take immediate action on any problems or changes that occur within the project. Identify the cause and effect and take necessary actions to correct problems. Notify the Project Designer and Construction Manager of factors that will impact the installation and construction contracts.Prepare data which reflects actual materials provided and labor expended in the installation of construction contracts.Serve as a first contact for customers.
Knowledge & Qualifications
Bachelor of Science Degree in Engineering, Mechanical or Electrical is preferred. Preference to candidates who are registered as a Professional Engineer in the province of Alberta by APEGA or will be eligible to be licensed by APEGA.Successful track record of leading, coordinating, and documenting meetings. Proven experience with the technical and commercial management of engineering, procurement, maintenance, and construction activities; and experience with cost estimating, forecasting, and risk management. Experience managing multi discipline projects in industrial construction project management or leading "Engineer to Order" and "Configure to Order" Operations with high levels of customer service is a plus.Heat Trace Design experience and product knowledge is a strong asset.
What You Bring To This Role
Strong cross-cultural communicator and relationship builder at all levels of internal and client organization(s) with the ability to work effectively across functionsWell-developed business acumen and be able to balance a strategic focus with the ability to dig into the details administratively and drive day-to-day performanceStrong operations leader with additional experience in other areas such as manufacturing, engineering, R&D, business, and market developmentProven collaborator and relationship building.Experience in at least one significant heavy industrial EPC/EPCM project is preferred.Basic knowledge of industry standards such as electrical codes such as the CEC, NEC or certification standards such as CSA, UL, IEC is a plus.Proficiency with project management and accounting tools.Ability to manage cost account management and reporting. Ability to travel 30% mostly domestic visiting job site locations.

companyDescription.text: AECOM is the world’s trusted infrastructure consulting firm, delivering professional services throughout the project lifecycle – from advisory, planning, design and engineering to program and construction management. On projects spanning transportation, buildings, water, new energy and the environment, our public- and private-sector clients trust us to solve their most complex challenges. Our teams are driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world through our unrivaled technical and digital expertise, a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion, and a commitment to environmental, social and governance priorities. AECOM is a Fortune 500 firm and its Professional Services business had revenue of $13.1 billion in fiscal year 2022. See how we are delivering sustainable legacies for generations to come at aecom.com and @AECOM.

description.text:
Company Description
 
At AECOM, we’re delivering a better world.
 
We believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether it’s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive.
 
Our clients trust us to bring together the best people, ideas, technical expertise and digital solutions to our work in transportation, buildings, water, the environment and new energy. We’re one global team – 47,000 strong – driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world.
 
Here, you will have freedom to grow in a world of opportunity.
 
We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.
 
You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.
 
We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business.
 
We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career.
 
When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.
 
Job Description
 
AECOM is seeking a qualified Lead Airside Design Engineer to join our team in Canada.
 
As a member of our team, your responsibilities would be the following:
 Assist or act as the lead pavement engineer and/or project manager for airside pavement engineering and/or pavement management projects. Provide leadership through technical supervision and mentoring of junior team members. Provide relevant feedback and instructions to team members and relevant updates to clients. Adhere to project schedules, budgets, and objectives. Participate in internal and external project meetings. Plan, organize, and carry out pavement evaluations and investigations. Write and review/approve reports and specifications and make presentations. Preparing technical reports, including technical specifications, pavement design reports. Completion of Pavement Condition Index (PCI), assessment of airside pavement types and rehabilitation. Establishes design criteria and performs detailed design for civil works related to runways, taxiways and aprons, holding and deicing bays. Assist other Project Managers in preparing field documentation and organizing field activities. Prepare staging / phasing plans for pavement construction and submits to / coordinates with airport operations team / Transport Canada as applicable. Perform quality control/quality assurance of field work, field data analysis and interpretation, and engineering calculations. Perform review of pavement engineering analysis, designs, performance data, and reports. Assist other team members with the preparation of proposals and expressions of interest considering the methodology for undertaking potential projects. Other office and/or offsite activities, as required. 
Qualifications
 
Minimum Requirements:
 Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering + 8 years experience in airfield engineering design Registered professional engineer or eligible within 18 months Valid full passenger-vehicle driver’s license for applicable province. 
Preferred Qualifications:
 Bachelor degree with emphasis in Pavement Engineering, Geotechnical Engineering, or any related technical field. Ideally 12+ years of experienced in airfield engineering design Knowledge and experience of airfield pavement, drainage, grading design, materials specification and maintenance. 
Additional Information
 
With infrastructure investment accelerating worldwide, our services are in great demand, and there’s never been a better time to be at AECOM! Join us, and you’ll get all the benefits of being a part of a global, publicly traded firm – access to industry-leading technology and thinking and transformational work with big impact and work flexibility.
 
AECOM provides a wide array of compensation and benefits programs to meet the diverse needs of our employees and their families. We also provide a robust global well-being program. We’re the world’s trusted global infrastructure firm, and we’re in this together – your growth and success are ours too.
 
As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.
 
Join us and let’s get started.
 
ReqID: J10088963
 
Business Line: Transportation
 
Business Group: DCS
 
Strategic Business Unit: Canada
 
Career Area: Engineering
 
Work Location Model: Hybrid

Other office and/or offsite activities, as required.

 Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering + 8 years experience in airfield engineering design Registered professional engineer or eligible within 18 months Valid full passenger-vehicle driver’s license for applicable province. 
Preferred Qualifications:
 Bachelor degree with emphasis in Pavement Engineering, Geotechnical Engineering, or any related technical field. Ideally 12+ years of experienced in airfield engineering design Knowledge and experience of airfield pavement, drainage, grading design, materials specification and maintenance. 
Additional Information
 
With infrastructure investment accelerating worldwide, our services are in great demand, and there’s never been a better time to be at AECOM! companyDescription.text: AECOM is the world’s trusted infrastructure consulting firm, delivering professional services throughout the project lifecycle – from advisory, planning, design and engineering to program and construction management. On projects spanning transportation, buildings, water, new energy and the environment, our public- and private-sector clients trust us to solve their most complex challenges. Our teams are driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world through our unrivaled technical and digital expertise, a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion, and a commitment to environmental, social and governance priorities. AECOM is a Fortune 500 firm and its Professional Services business had revenue of $13.1 billion in fiscal year 2022. See how we are delivering sustainable legacies for generations to come at aecom.com and @AECOM.

description.text:
Company Description
 
At AECOM, we’re delivering a better world.
 
We believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether it’s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive.
 
Our clients trust us to bring together the best people, ideas, technical expertise and digital solutions to our work in transportation, buildings, water, the environment and new energy. We’re one global team – 47,000 strong – driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world.
 
Here, you will have freedom to grow in a world of opportunity.
 
We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.
 
You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.
 
We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business.
 
We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career.
 
When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.
 
Job Description
 
AECOM is seeking a qualified Lead Airside Design Engineer to join our team in Canada.
 
As a member of our team, your responsibilities would be the following:
 Assist or act as the lead pavement engineer and/or project manager for airside pavement engineering and/or pavement management projects. Provide leadership through technical supervision and mentoring of junior team members. Provide relevant feedback and instructions to team members and relevant updates to clients. Adhere to project schedules, budgets, and objectives. Participate in internal and external project meetings. Plan, organize, and carry out pavement evaluations and investigations. Write and review/approve reports and specifications and make presentations. Preparing technical reports, including technical specifications, pavement design reports. Completion of Pavement Condition Index (PCI), assessment of airside pavement types and rehabilitation. Establishes design criteria and performs detailed design for civil works related to runways, taxiways and aprons, holding and deicing bays. Assist other Project Managers in preparing field documentation and organizing field activities. Prepare staging / phasing plans for pavement construction and submits to / coordinates with airport operations team / Transport Canada as applicable. Perform quality control/quality assurance of field work, field data analysis and interpretation, and engineering calculations. Perform review of pavement engineering analysis, designs, performance data, and reports. Assist other team members with the preparation of proposals and expressions of interest considering the methodology for undertaking potential projects. Other office and/or offsite activities, as required. 
Qualifications
 
Minimum Requirements:
 Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering + 8 years experience in airfield engineering design Registered professional engineer or eligible within 18 months Valid full passenger-vehicle driver’s license for applicable province. 
Preferred Qualifications:
 Bachelor degree with emphasis in Pavement Engineering, Geotechnical Engineering, or any related technical field. Ideally 12+ years of experienced in airfield engineering design Knowledge and experience of airfield pavement, drainage, grading design, materials specification and maintenance. 
Additional Information
 
With infrastructure investment accelerating worldwide, our services are in great demand, and there’s never been a better time to be at AECOM! Join us, and you’ll get all the benefits of being a part of a global, publicly traded firm – access to industry-leading technology and thinking and transformational work with big impact and work flexibility.
 
AECOM provides a wide array of compensation and benefits programs to meet the diverse needs of our employees and their families. We also provide a robust global well-being program. We’re the world’s trusted global infrastructure firm, and we’re in this together – your growth and success are ours too.
 
As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.
 
Join us and let’s get started.

description.text:
Description de l'entreprise Nous pourrions vous dire que nous sommes une entreprise de télécommunication et de divertissement à la fine pointe de la technologie. Que nous sommes constamment en évolution pour non seulement offrir ce qu’il y a de mieux à nos clients, mais aussi à nos employés; après tout ce sont eux notre plus grande force. Description du poste Prendre en charge entièrement des projets d’analyse de données au sein de l’équipe Science des données ; Offrir un rôle-conseil auprès de la clientèle interne via l’analyse, la compréhension et l’organisation de leurs besoins ; Représenter le secteur dans les comités de travail corporatifs ; Participer à la mise en place d’actions tactiques ciblées ; Rédiger des analyses et notes de synthèses et en assurer la diffusion ; Identifier des client
es potentielles pour les activités de sollicitation, s’assurer de la production de listes et de leur livraison dans les formats appropriés ; Développer, automatiser et présenter les résultats des rapports aux clientes internes ; Participer à l’élaboration des indicateurs de performance permettant de mesurer l’efficacité des activités menées ; Développer une connaissance approfondie de la clientèle résidentielle et commerciale de Vidéotron et des marchés dans lesquels œuvre l’entreprise. Qualifications Détenir une maîtrise ou un baccalauréat en administration (méthodes quantitatives), en économie, en mathématiques (statistiques) ou dans une discipline connexe ; Posséder 5 à 7 ans d’expérience pertinente ; Solides aptitudes de programmation en SQL, R, Python ; Maîtrise des outils SAS et Tableau ; Expérience avec Spark, Pandas, Numpy et Scikit-learn (atout) ; Être en mesure de monter des modèles statistiques ; Maîtrise du français et de l’anglais parlé et écrit. Informations supplémentaires La suite des choses ? Au-delà du CV, on cherche avant tout une personnalité. Dans ce sens, si nous avons l’impression que vous avez le profil de l’emploi, nous vous contacterons pour en discuter de vive voix et vous ferons part des prochaines étapes afin de mieux nous montrer qui vous êtes… Vidéotron remercie tous les candidats et les candidates qui postuleront. La diversité est une pratique fondamentale dans notre processus de recrutement. Ainsi, nous souscrivons au principe d'équité en emploi et offrons des chances d'emploi égales à tous.

companyDescription.text:
Here at Globe 24-7 (Globe), we’ve made mining talent consulting and recruitment our life’s work. Globe has been a landmark in the mining recruitment space for nearly two decades, where we have supported mining operations in over 50 countries. We’ve helped a broad spectrum of emerging, mid-tier and large-scale operations source incredible talent. Our expertise can add value to every facet of your recruitment, succession planning, FIFO mental health, and onboarding needs.

In the beginning, we started off as an HR Consulting firm in Perth, Western Australia, and we’ve risen to be recognised as one of the world’s premium talent consulting and recruitment companies. We know what we're good at. Our deep and relevant experience helps mining companies find the best people for their companies.

We can help your company at any stage, from exploration through project development, and operations. Our expertise extends from highly targeted executive talent search to RPO services, HR consulting, and onboarding support. We understand the cost of a bad hire, and won’t let it happen to you. Drawing on our years of experience, our internal capability, and our deep industry knowledge, we are proud to support mining companies regardless of their location.

description.text:
Globe 24-7 in partnership with their client in Toronto, Canada is looking to fill a Principal Engineer, Metallurgy & Process position.
 
The client is an intermediate gold producer engaged in the exploration, development and operation of their wholly-owned property in Mexico. The Company is based in Canada, with their Corporate Office located in Toronto, Ontario, Canada.
 
The Principal Engineer, Metallurgy and Processing will be accountable for the management and development of systems and processes related to the efficient processing of ore. This is a corporate-based, full-time, permanent position, with frequent travel to site required. Our client offers a hybrid work model for corporate office employees.
 
THE RESPONSIBILITIES
 
Efficient Processing of Ore
Managing the ongoing production planning through Establishment of Processing (Milling) rates based on characteristics of the OreForecasting the uptime of each facility to advise operations on optimal amount of uptime through the identification of appropriate internal and external benchmarksProvides advice and guidance to plant metallurgy group on metallurgical testing programs and standardsProvides framework for equipment standards of use, verifies equipment is running effectively at each Plant within established parametersDeveloping of metallurgy and processing reporting standards for site and corporateEstablishes benchmarks and standards for site performance against budget; analyzes reports and produces overall summary of deviationsWork with site to determine mitigation strategies as appropriateAnalyze KPIs to establish recommended guidance on operating costs; analyzes reports and produces overall cost report 
Ore Production Governance and Strategy
Contributes to the delivery of the long-term processing rates and metals component of the LOM Plans through research and calculationsAudits sites for adherence to short-term and medium-term processing rates and the metal component of LOM PlansReviews monthly Metallurgical Accounting reports, ensuring there is integrity in the numbers reported; reports any anomalies to Team LeaderInvestigates root cause of discrepancies in Metallurgy Accounting reports and work with site leadership to develop plans to mitigateContributes to the analysis of mining data to provide guidance to internal teams through research and calculationsSupports the development of the long-term strategy to optimize the processing of ore across all processing facilities through research and calculations 
Supports M&A Prospects
Supports the technical due diligence for metallurgy and processing-related aspects required for future M&A prospects 
 
THE REQUIREMENTS 
 
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Chemical, Metallurgical, or Mineral Processing EngineeringProfessional Engineer designation15+ years of progressive technical, operational, engineering, and management experience with at least 10 years in process operationsExperience in precious and base metals processing, including water systems and tailings managementExperience in life-of-mine planning, including budgeting and metal planningExperience in metallurgical accounting principles and standardsExperience in gold mining is preferredKnowledge & Skills:
Proven experience establishing, measuring, and communicating all aspects of business performanceAbility to present to and collaborate with peer corporate leaders and site leadersKnowledge of metals marketingAbility to work in multicultural environmentsSpanish language knowledge (written, spoken, and read) 
THE REWARDS
 
The position offers a competitive remuneration package. This is a full-time, permanent position.
 
CONTACT US

 Please apply directly by submitting your resume, preferably as a Microsoft Word document. Please note, that due to the number of applications we receive, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
